22.02.text:
JERRY: Hello, everyone. I'm
Jerry Savelle. Thank you for

23.82.text:
watching our broadcast today. We
appreciate you taking time out

27.46.text:
of your busy lives to tune
in and I believe, praise God,

30.80.text:
you're going to be glad that you
watched the broadcast today.

33.60.text:
You're going to learn some
things about keys to a

35.80.text:
flourishing lifestyle. Back in
November of 2016, the Spirit of

41.04.text:
the Lord said to me in a
prophetic word that beginning in

44.28.text:
2017, the faithful shall
flourish and it will be like

47.88.text:
days of Heaven on earth. I
have with me today, once again,

51.59.text:
Pastor Justin Bridges, pastor of
the Heritage of Faith Christian

55.56.text:
Center, an outreach of Jerry
Savelle Ministries here in

58.23.text:
Crowley, Texas. By the way, if
you're ever in our area, come

61.09.text:
and join us even if I'm not
there, which I'm not there very

64.43.text:
often because I'm preaching
somewhere around the world.

67.67.text:
Justin's there just about every
Sunday. I'll tell you you will

72.04.text:
not be disappointed when you
come and hear Justin. Justin,

74.74.text:
thank you for joining me again
this week. JUSTIN: Honored to be

76.88.text:
here, Dr. Savelle. JERRY: Thank
you. We're continuing to talk

80.81.text:
about keys to a flourishing
lifestyle. I want to talk about

85.02.text:
flourishing spiritually, first
of all, today. I want to read to

90.22.text:
you from Psalm 92 and verse 12,
"The righteous shall flourish

96.13.text:
like the palm tree. He shall
grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

99.47.text:
Those that be planted in the
house of the Lord shall flourish

102.77.text:
in the courts of our God. They
shall still bring forth fruit in

106.97.text:
old age. They shall be fat
or prosperous and flourishing."

111.65.text:
Verses 12, 13, and 14 mention
the term flourishing. God's plan

118.12.text:
is that the righteous shall
flourish. Now, righteous people

122.49.text:
simply means those that have
right standing with God. That's

125.86.text:
not something you can do. That's
not something you can earn.

129.00.text:
Jesus got it for you. When he
went to Calvary, gave his life,

133.20.text:
shed his blood, the Bible says,
"He who knew no sin was made to

137.94.text:
be sin for us, that we might be
made the righteousness of God."

141.74.text:
I'm already righteous. JUSTIN:
Amen. Me too. JERRY: You're

144.34.text:
already righteous, praise God.
If you've made Jesus the Lord of

147.61.text:
your life, you're already
righteous. Now, God's plan is

150.98.text:
that you will flourish. Now, the
Amplified Bible says be

156.86.text:
uncompromisingly righteous.
In other places, it says be

160.89.text:
consistently righteous. Those
are all terms related to

164.93.text:
faithfulness. The faithful shall
flourish and it will be like

169.67.text:
days of Heaven on earth. In
other words, it's just going to

172.54.text:
get so good you're going to
think you're already in Heaven.

175.01.text:
Praise God. It begins with
flourishing spiritually. Now,

179.95.text:
let me read to you from 2
Corinthians chapter 5 and verse

184.58.text:
17, "Therefore, if any man be in
Christ, he is a new creation.

189.39.text:
All things are passed away.
Behold, all things are become

194.56.text:
new." That is the starting point
for flourishing. You make Jesus

199.63.text:
the Lord of your life.
Your spirit is recreated,

202.80.text:
recreated in the
image of Christ, and that

206.51.text:
begins your pursuit
of flourishing. You must

210.84.text:
be born again. Then it
says, "All things become new."

214.68.text:
Life is going to become new to
you. My life has never been the

218.89.text:
same since the day I made Jesus
the Lord of my life. Then it

223.32.text:
says in Galatians chapter 3
verses 13 and 14, "Christ hath

228.16.text:
redeemed us from the curse of
the law, being made a curse for

231.90.text:
us. Christ has redeemed us from
the curse of the law, that the

236.74.text:
blessing of Abraham might come
on the Gentiles through Jesus

240.31.text:
Christ." Now, you'll find the
blessing of Abraham recorded in

244.85.text:
Deuteronomy chapter 28. It
covers that man's life spirit,

249.22.text:
soul, body, and financially. God
wants us to flourish in every

253.55.text:
area of our life. JUSTIN: Amen.
JERRY: It all begins with

257.29.text:
flourishing spiritually. That
takes place the moment you are

262.46.text:
born again. Now let me read this
and then I'm going to ask Justin

264.90.text:
to make some comments on it. 1
Peter chapter 2 and verse 3, "As

270.04.text:
new born babes desire the
sincere milk of the

273.61.text:
Word that you may
grow thereby." Now,

277.14.text:
flourishing means to
thrive. It means to grow.

279.95.text:
It means to become strong.
It means to make steady

283.12.text:
progress. Right here, Peter is
saying that when you're born

286.79.text:
again, the first thing you need
to do is get in the Word, that

291.02.text:
you may grow thereby. JUSTIN:
Yeah, got to get in the Word.

294.26.text:
For me, in 1993 when I had an
experience, you know, I was a

299.53.text:
new creation. I had to now renew
my mind. Now that I'm born

306.54.text:
again, I couldn't remain the way
because my entire life up to

309.64.text:
that time had been totally led
by my mind, my will, and my

312.98.text:
emotions. All of a sudden, now I
have to live in a different

316.02.text:
order. Now I have to live out of
this reborn nature. Now I have

319.39.text:
to live out of this reborn
spirit. How am I going to do

321.59.text:
that? Is in the come down to the
Word of God. In Ephesians four,

325.93.text:
it talks about the gifts that
were sent into the body that we

329.80.text:
might grow up into all things
into him who is Christ. JERRY:

332.90.text:
Yeah, let me interrupt you a
moment there. The Amplified

336.27.text:
Bible says in Ephesians 4:18,
"Let us grow up in every way and

341.88.text:
in all things." God wants us to
flourish not only spiritually,

347.05.text:
get stronger spiritually,
get stronger in our faith, get

351.59.text:
stronger in our walk with him,
get stronger in our confidence

354.55.text:
in his ability to see us
through, but he wants us to

358.02.text:
flourish spiritually, mentally,
physically, and financially.

362.46.text:
That is flourishing in every way
and in all things. There's no

368.03.text:
flourishing outside of the Word
of God. JUSTIN: Impossible.

371.30.text:
JERRY: Impossible. JUSTIN: The
Word is what gives us his will.

374.67.text:
The Word is what gives us his
desire. The Word is what tells

378.25.text:
us how we should be living.
Jesus was the Word and the Word

382.88.text:
was made flesh and dwelt among
us. The Word is what we need to

386.42.text:
live by. We need to fix our
mind, fix our attention on the

390.56.text:
Qord. How do we fix attention to
know God's will? Is by fixing

395.06.text:
our eyes on his Word. JERRY: You
know, the first scripture that I

399.50.text:
read, I received the Lord
February 11, 1969. February 12,

404.44.text:
I started studying the Word. The
first scripture that I ever read

409.58.text:
was John chapter 8 verses 31 and
32. It says, "If you continue in

415.68.text:
my Word, then you are my
disciples indeed and you will

419.65.text:
know the truth and the truth
will make you free." That little

423.66.text:
word, continue, it got as big
as my Bible. It jumped off the

428.40.text:
pages and into my heart. The
Lord said, "That's the key to

433.43.text:
your success." He said, "You've
been a good starter all of your

436.87.text:
life, but you've never continued
anything." He said, "If you're

440.31.text:
ever going to be the man I want
you to be, the husband I want

444.24.text:
you to be, the father I want you

446.95.text:
to be, then you're going to have

450.28.text:
continuing. Continue in my

455.96.text:
event. That's not study it
Sunday morning before you go to

459.19.text:
church. That's not, you
know, just reading a couple of

463.36.text:
scriptures every night before
you go to bed. That is a process

467.63.text:
that God expects you to do for
the rest of your life. He says,

472.01.text:
"If you will continue in my
word, then you will know the

474.84.text:
truth." JUSTIN: That's it.
JERRY: Now, I looked up the

477.54.text:
definition for the word truth
and it says, "The highest form

480.81.text:
of reality that exists." You
will know the truth. The truth

485.35.text:
is the highest form of reality
that exists. That means it's

490.89.text:
higher than what the world
considers to be the truth. You

495.20.text:
know, the world says everybody

497.50.text:
There's a higher truth. The
world says everybody got to go

501.07.text:
broke sometimes. There's a
higher truth. My God shall

504.00.text:
supply all my needs according to
his riches and glory. If you

507.51.text:
continue in the Word, you're
going to know the truth and the

511.11.text:
truth will make you free, praise
God. Once again, that's a daily

515.22.text:
process. It's not starting it.
It's not, you know, getting

520.65.text:
discouraged. It's not if it
doesn't seem to be producing any

524.22.text:
results, quit. Continue means
continue. JUSTIN: You know, with

528.56.text:
that, by fixing our attention on
the word, I'm just reminded of

531.40.text:
Romans chapter 12 when it says
for us not to be conformed to

535.00.text:
the world, but be transformed by
the renewing of our mind. I've

538.34.text:
always looked it this way. I'm
either going to be conformed to

541.74.text:
the world or I'm going to be
transformed by the Word. It's

544.74.text:
either/or. Constantly, every day
of our lives, we're being

547.81.text:
conformed to something. The
question is I'm going to be

550.62.text:
conformed to whatever I'm
focusing on. I'm going to be

553.22.text:
conformed to whatever I'm giving
attention to. If I'm giving

555.42.text:
attention to God's Word, if I'm
giving attention to his

558.32.text:

to Jesus and his path for my

561.69.text:

transformed to that. If I'm

564.86.text:

world's reports, I'm giving my

567.37.text:
attention to everything else
around me and my environment,

569.67.text:
then I'm going to become like
it. I'm going to fit into its

572.27.text:
mold. JERRY: That's right. Yeah,
I believe it's the Phillips

575.08.text:
Translation that says, "Don't
allow the world around you to

580.25.text:
squeeze you into its mold."
JUSTIN: Right. It wants to.

583.18.text:
JERRY: It will try. You
know, when you first start out,

587.22.text:
consequently, that's all you
know is the world's way, the

592.93.text:
world's method, the carnal
knowledge. That's all you know.

597.63.text:
When you get into the Word of
God, you're going to start

601.03.text:
reading things that are both
contrary to the way you were

605.47.text:
brought up, contrary to the way
you were taught. You know, I

609.08.text:
remember the first time I heard
Kenneth Copeland back in 1969

612.38.text:
and his message has changed my
life. I remember the statement

617.28.text:
that he made quite often in his
services. "I'm not moved by what

621.55.text:
I see. I'm not moved by what I
feel. I'm not moved by what I

626.49.text:
hear. I'm only moved by what I
believe and I believe the Word

630.43.text:
of God." JUSTIN: That's it.
JERRY: I'm sitting there

631.97.text:
thinking, "Boy, I am. I'm moved
by what I see. I'm moved by what

636.97.text:
I feel. I'm moved by what I
hear." See, that's the way I was

641.17.text:
brought up. That's the way we
were trained from infancy, to be

646.05.text:
moved by what we see, what we
hear, what we feel. The Bible

650.95.text:
says we walk by faith and not by

655.92.text:
can see is not permanent. The
Bible says it's temporary. What

662.60.text:
the Word says is eternal. The
Bible says, "The grass withers,

667.90.text:
the flower fades, but the Word
of our God shall stand forever."

671.44.text:
If I'm choosing to believe the
Word of God more than what I can

676.68.text:
see, more than what I can feel,
and more than what I can hear,

680.28.text:
if I will stick to the Word,
hold fast to the Word,

683.75.text:
eventually what I see, what I
feel, and what I hear will

688.19.text:
change and line up with the Word
of God. Amen. JUSTIN: This Word

692.26.text:
has power. It says it's sharper

696.56.text:

there's power." There's power in

outdated book. No, this Word is

706.67.text:
for right now. JERRY: Yes.
JUSTIN: A lot of people think

708.24.text:
this Word is just some religious
book. No, it's something that

711.68.text:
will change your life today.
It's living. It's alive. In

714.98.text:
James chapter one, this went off
on me a few years back and just

720.25.text:
when I was praying over our
children and standing for some

723.52.text:
things, and it says this in

733.37.text:

736.30.text:
of God." What does that mean? It
means man's ways does not get

739.97.text:
God's results. It's just like
we're talking about renewing our

742.74.text:

745.95.text:
will not get God's results. If
you continue down the path that

749.15.text:
you've always been going or
continuing down the path that

751.72.text:
the rest of the world's going,
you're going to continue to get

753.99.text:
the same results. There has to
be something different. If we

757.46.text:
keep reading, it talks about

Putting away, we can say there's

763.36.text:
filthiness or superfluity

778.54.text:
into a heart because then it

see, Word has ability. This Word

786.69.text:
It says, "This engrafted Word."
What does that mean? When it

789.92.text:
becomes a part of you. When this

you whole. Spirit, soul, body,

financially, everything that you

804.24.text:
JERRY: That's right. It is the
source of everything that we

808.74.text:
need in this life, spiritually,
physically, mentally, and

financially. God has promised

816.88.text:
that you have. Now, where did I

Word. The Bible says that the

827.03.text:
shall not want. Where did I find

831.26.text:
don't live in doubt. I don't
live in wonderment. I know

837.20.text:
because the Word promises
me that my God shall supply my

841.74.text:
every need. I believe that,
praise God. Not only that, I've

845.41.text:
been living on that promise for
48 years and God has never let

849.35.text:
me down. God has never failed
me. He is a faithful God. He

853.99.text:
will continue to supply my
need no matter what's happening

857.56.text:
around me, no matter what's
happening in the world. God has

860.43.text:
promised that he will supply
my need and his Word will not

864.90.text:
return void. You've got to get

869.44.text:
just absolutely no way that you
will ever flourish in the things

873.64.text:
of God if you don't continue in
the Word of the Lord. Now, I

877.84.text:
wrote this down in my notes,
that the mission of Satan is to

883.42.text:
do these four things where the
Word of God is concerned. Number

886.75.text:
one, to weaken the authority of
the Word. Number two, to distort

891.19.text:
the true teachings of the Word.
Then, number three, to add man's

896.16.text:
ideas, thoughts, and vain
philosophies to the Word. Then,

900.93.text:
number four, if possible, put
the Word entirely aside. He does

905.94.text:
not want you getting in the Word
of God. You know, he don't mind

909.24.text:
you going to church just as long
as you go to a church where the

912.11.text:
Word's not preached. In fact,
he's the most faithful church

914.75.text:
member there. He don't care if
you go to church just as long as

919.12.text:
you don't go to a church that
preaches the Word. He don't care

922.62.text:
if you own a Bible. He don't

925.73.text:
have one in every room in your
house just as long as you never

929.93.text:
get in it. If you do get in it,
then he hopes that he has the

935.00.text:
ability or you give him the
ability to weaken the authority

938.87.text:
of it, to distort the true
meanings of it, to add man's

942.34.text:
ideas to it, or to put the power

947.45.text:
to make a determination that
once you get in the Word of God

951.15.text:
that you are there to stay. You
know, in those early days,

955.62.text:
Justin, not knowing anything
about the Word, it was not easy.

961.59.text:
I mean, you know, Carolyn had
been filled with the Holy Ghost

964.96.text:
since she was eight years old.
She went to church where they

969.34.text:
were a full Gospel church. She's
been speaking in tongues and

973.44.text:
filled with the Holy Ghost since
she was eight. She knew a whole

977.88.text:
lot more Word than I did. When I

981.95.text:
"Well, I guess it's like any
other book. You just start on

985.28.text:
page one." Man, I got so
bogged down in that. I got so

aggravated. I walked out of that

can't understand this." She

996.96.text:
said, "Page one. Isn't that

go start in the ministry of

1005.17.text:
got over in Matthew. I got lost

started there. I didn't

1037.90.text:

1049.15.text:
You're my guide. You're

1053.22.text:

I just prayed this in the

1062.83.text:
things I never seen before. It

1067.33.text:
a sudden, it was not just words

1075.78.text:

1094.86.text:

zowee, my life was totally

1123.12.text:
will forever be grateful for

1127.96.text:
my life. You've got to make the

1131.73.text:

1135.20.text:
you're going to spend quality
time in the Word and you've made

1138.90.text:
up your mind that you're not

1141.41.text:
then praise God, I'm telling you

1145.81.text:
is going to change so
drastically that people won't

1148.88.text:
even think you're the same

that is going to lead to a

you to watch now as our

ANNOUNCER: The faithful shall
flourish and it will be like

1178.74.text:
days of Heaven on Earth. The
Lord gave a prophetic word

1181.85.text:
saying that days like Heaven

1184.65.text:
faithful. But what does it mean
to be faithful? In the powerful

1188.02.text:
six CD series, Keys to a
Flourishing Lifestyle Jerry

1191.79.text:
Savelle teaches on faithfulness
for flourishing in every area of

1195.39.text:
your life as you listen to this
faith filled study you will

1198.70.text:
learn the differences between
being righteous and being
